Welcome to Phone Book’s documentation!¶

Phone Book main¶

Phone Book repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The data for the contact to create.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(days: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Returns a list of contact(-s) who has birthday within specified range of days for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – The number of days that define the range.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to show the contact(-s) for.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • offset (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(search: str, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Searches of a contact by fields ‘name’, ‘lastname’ or ‘email’ for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • search (str) – The field with information for search the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to search the contact for.

Returns:

The contact that matches the search, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated data for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_status_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactStatusUpdate, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

Updates the status (i.e. “favourite” or “not favourite”) of a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactStatusUpdate) – The updated status for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The async database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None
